titles.title: To allow workers certified to receive trade adjustment assistance under the Trade Act of 1974 who are rehired by the same employer to continue to receive such assistance if they are subsequently unable to work because of a lock-out in the course of a labor dispute.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 6/24/2004--Introduced. Amends the Trade Act of 1974 to allow workers certified to receive trade adjustment assistance who are rehired by the same employer to continue to receive such assistance if they are subsequently unable to work because of a lock-out in the course of a labor dispute. Requires the Secretary of Labor to issue a six-month waiver to such workers of the requirement to be enrolled in training.
